page.title: 10DIALECTS AND ACCENTS
page.content: FEW PEOPLE IN THE AREA STILL TALK WITH THE OLD ESSEX/SUFFOLK ACCENT EXCEPT FOR SOME OF THE OLDER PEOPLE.BULMER SCHOOL HOWEVER HAD TWO BOYS WHO PRONOUNCED BIRDS AS 'BUDS'.'I'VE FOUND SUFFEN' SAID ONE LITTLE OULD SCHOOLBOY RECENTLY ON TURNING OVER A STONE AND THE MUCK HEAP IS THE DUNGLE.HEAD IS STILL USED MEANING CHIEF OR BEST:'THAT WERE THE HEAD HOLIDAY AS I EVER HAD'.THE SUFFOLK 'BOR' IS USED AS WELL AS THE ESSEX'BOEY'& THAT 'OULD' IS VERY MUCH IN EVIDENCE.THE PRESENT WRITER HAS JEST ABOUT FINISHED THIS LITTLE OULD PAGE.ASHLEY COOPER'S 'THE LONG FURROW'& BASIL SLAUGHTER'S 'AN ESSEX & SUFFOLK ALPHABET' ARE VERY USEFUL BOOKS ON LOCAL CUSTOMS.DETAILS OF THEM FROM BULMER HIST.SOC.6 PARK LANE,BULMER,SUDBURY,SUFFOLK CO10 7EQ
